com.dictionary.api
Class MapReduce

java.lang.Object
  com.dictionary.api.MapReduce

public class MapReduce
extends java.lang.Object

Author:
nitinpai This is the core logic for creation of the dictionary used by DictionaryApp. It consists of 2 passes to get the dictionary created
  1. MAP - the map logic divides the text files into tokens, converts them to Word and creates an index consisting of all words
  2. REDUCE - the reduce logic converts the indexed map of Word to a hierarchy map having set of Word assigned at a particular level, resulting in a dictionary

Constructor Summary
MapReduce()

 void map(java.lang.String[] tokens, java.util.Map<java.lang.String,Word> index)
          Gets inputs as string tokens from a line in a file and creates @see Word The index is updated with the newly created words If a comment is encountered either at the beginning or in the middle the entire line post the # is ignored If a token with a primitive (.) is encountered it results in creation of a Word which has no attributes
 java.lang.Integer reduce(Word word, java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,java.util.Set<Word>> dictionary)

Method Detail

map

public void map(java.lang.String[] tokens,
                java.util.Map<java.lang.String,Word> index)
Gets inputs as string tokens from a line in a file and creates @see Word The index is updated with the newly created words If a comment is encountered either at the beginning or in the middle the entire line post the # is ignored If a token with a primitive (.) is encountered it results in creation of a Word which has no attributes

Parameters:
tokens - - Split string tokens from each line in a file
index - - The index which would include all the tokens in the form of Word

reduce

public java.lang.Integer reduce(Word word,
                                java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,java.util.Set<Word>> dictionary)
The reduce logic takes in a Word and recursively processes its attributes to build a hierarchy. The hierarchy is built by assigning a level to each Word the logic processes For example: if B and C define A then B and C will be at level 0 and A will be at level 1 In the above example if C defines B then C will be a 0 and B will be a 1. This in turn put A at level 2 After a hierarchy is defined for a Word it is inserted into the dictionary at the level designated to it

Parameters:
word - - A Word which has to be processed for determining its hierarchy
dictionary - - Map to hold references to each level of the processed Word
Returns:
Level of the Word being processed
